intro: Onychium robustum, commonly known as the robust onychium, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants such as buckwheat and sorrel. The plant is characterized by its erect, branched stems and clusters of small, pinkish to reddish flowers. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in a dense layer of fine hairs. Onychium robustum is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is adapted to grow in cooler, high-altitude environments.
